landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges a lease/tenancy and rent payments and identifies Defendant as the landlord/owner/agent of the premises (see ¶¶1.2, 1.4, 3.1), which sufficiently pleads a landlord–tenant relationship.

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant was notified of the electrical failure, arranged an inspection, but has not arranged, commenced, or completed the necessary permanent repair and has not provided a timetable (see ¶¶3.3–3.4, 3.7), alleging an omission to repair.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges one of two bedrooms has lacked electricity for ~six weeks (¶3.2), the bedroom was used as Plaintiff’s home office and is unusable (¶3.5), Plaintiff must leave the premises to work and crowd belongings into the living room (¶3.5–3.6), and incurred out‑of‑pocket expenses (¶3.6) — facts showing substantial interference with beneficial use of a material portion of the premises.

causation.reasoning: Complaint alleges the electrician determined extensive wiring repair was required (¶3.3), Plaintiff notified Defendant and Defendant failed to effectuate repair (¶¶3.3–3.4, 3.7), and states the interference and expenses are a direct/proximate result of Defendant’s failure to repair (¶¶3.6, 3.8), adequately pleading causation.

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges specific out‑of‑pocket damages (daily expenditures and coworking membership) and loss of use, emotional distress, and estimates total damages of ~$900 (¶¶3.6, 3.8, 4.1), sufficiently pleading damages.
